structural_analysis.context_justification: The document starts with the Third Adhyāya (तृतीयोऽध्यायः) and the First Brāhmaṇa (प्रथमं ब्राह्मणम्). The first parsed unit/Mantra is numbered 1. Hence, the starting coordinate is 3.1.1.
structural_analysis.filename_justification: Combines grantha ID, commentary author slug, and zero-padded start ID (03-01-01) for unique, sortable naming.

proposed_strategy.name: Validated Group by Character Count (Brahmana Level)
proposed_strategy.description: This strategy groups consecutive Brāhmaṇas, ensuring the resulting chunk size remains below the 125,000 character limit while maximizing the content per chunk.

execution_plan.description: Prefatory material, Upakrama Śāntipāṭha, Maṅgalācaraṇam, and Brāhmaṇas 3.1 through 3.3 (Aśva, Aśvamedha, Udgītha Brāhmaṇas).
Brāhmaṇas 3.4 through 3.6 (Ātman, Saptānna, and Triyam Brāhmaṇas), concluding the Third Adhyāya.

parsing_instructions.justification: The Adhyāya is clearly divided into semantic Brāhmaṇas which serve as the ideal high-level structural units for parsing and indexing.
parsing_instructions.numbering_capture_strategy: Extract the Devanagari numeral found at the very end of the Mantra line, typically within double pipes (e.g. || 1 ||, || 2 ||).

start_pattern.description: A new Brāhmaṇa begins with a bolded heading indicating its ordinal number.

end_pattern.description: The end of a Brāhmaṇa (including its commentary) is marked by a concluding line mentioning the end of the section's Prakāśikā.

parsing_instructions.pre_content_handling: Handle the initial Śāntipāṭha, Maṅgalācaraṇam, and Avatārikā (introductory material) as a 'Prefatory' section before the first Brāhmaṇa (3.1).
